item.title: Free will, ego, and morals
item.description: Let’s define what these terms mean first, then state the goal of this article, and then we dive in. Definitions copied from dictionary: What do these terms mean: Free will: the power of acting without the constraint of necessity or fate; the ability to act at one’s own discretion. Morals: Standards of behaviour; principles of right and wrong. The code of conduct you carry, and which decides your behaviour in a certain situation.
